required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Intranasal Fentanyl Spray for the Treatment of Breakthrough Pain in Cancer Patients Older Than 18 Years
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Non-interventional/Observational Patient Cohort Study on the Efficacy of Intranasal Fentanyl Spray for the Treatment of Breakthrough Pain in Cancer Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of intranasal fentanyl spray in cancer patients over four weeks, especially during cancer-related breakthrough pain (BTP) attacks. The fentanyl spray was applied into the nose by a metered-spray device. The study was to provide further data on pharmacoeconomic efficiency of intranasal fentanyl spray.

intervention.description: This was an observational study. Therefore, the physician decided about dosage according to individual needs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- decision to start treatment with intranasal fentanyl spray
- written informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
- criteria as defined in the Summary of Product Characteristics (Fachinformation Chapter 4.3)

overall_official.last_name: Dr. Thomas D. Bethke, PhD; MD

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Number of valid cases = 130. Number of valid cases = patients with data available.

measure.title: Gender, Customized
Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Number of valid cases = 126. Number of valid cases = patients with data available.

measure.title: Tumor diagnosis (malignant neop-lasms ICD10)

class.title: C00-C14 lip, oral cavity and pharynx
C73-C75 thyroid and other endocrine glands
C81-C96 lymphoid, hematopoietic and related tissue

measure.title: Karnofsky-index
measure.description: score 0= worst (death) , 100= best (no limitation in health) Number of valid cases = 125. Number of valid cases = patients with data available.

measure.title: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA)-physical state (2-5)
measure.description: ASA = physical status. state 2: patient with slight generalized disease state 3: patient with severe generalized disease state 4: life threatening generalized disease state 5: moribund patient, unlikly to survive without operation

measure.title: ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status (0-4)
measure.description: ECOG 0 (fully active) ECOG 1 (restricted in strenuous activity, ambulatory) ECOG 2 (ambulatory, up and about more than 50% of waking hours ECOG 3 (limited selfcare, confined to bed > 50% of waking hours ECOG 4 (completely disabled, no selfcare)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
